alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Collier County through 400 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Everglades City, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marco Island, Chokoloskee, Everglades City, Plantation Island, Carnestown, Cape Romano, Copeland, Royal Palm Hammock, Big Cypress National Preserve, Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Port Of The Island, Goodland, Key Marco, Cape Romano Aquatic Preserve, Jerome and Deep Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe
